headline.main: U.N. Authorizes States to Help Libya Dispose of Chemicals
headline.print_headline: U.N. Authorizes States to Help Libya Dispose of Chemicals

docs.snippet: The United Nations Security Council on Friday authorized U.N. countries to help eliminate Libya's stockpile of chemicals that could be used to develop toxic weapons amid concern they could fall into the hands of militant groups....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council on Friday authorized U.N. countries to help eliminate Libya's stockpile of chemicals that could be used to develop toxic weapons amid concern they could fall into the hands of militant groups.

headline.main: An Olympic Odyssey: Where the Games Began

docs.snippet: A road trip in Greece back in time nearly 3,000 years to the precursors of the modern Olympic Games. Plato sweated here....
docs.abstract: Bill Hayes travel article recounts his exploration of cities Isthmia, Nemea, Delphi and Olympia in Greece, uncovering history and origins of first Olympic Games, collectively known in earliest times as Panhellenic Games.
docs.lead_paragraph: A road trip in Greece back in time nearly 3,000 years to the precursors of the modern Olympic Games. Plato sweated here.

headline.main: Is China Stealing Jobs? It May Be Losing Them, Instead
headline.print_headline: China, Long Accused of Stealing Jobs, Now Appears to Be Losing Them Instead

docs.snippet: With a slowing domestic economy, rising costs and stiffer foreign competition, China’s laborers are losing jobs, including to the United States....
docs.abstract: Many workers in China are losing their jobs due to slowing domestic economy, escalating costs and more foreign competition, including from United States; one estimate says unemployment and underemployment in China will reach 12.9 percent in 2016, triple level  in 2012.
docs.lead_paragraph: With a slowing domestic economy, rising costs and stiffer foreign competition, China’s laborers are losing jobs, including to the United States.

headline.main: Ivory Coast Parliament Votes to Hold Referendum on New Constitution
headline.print_headline: Ivory Coast Parliament Votes to Hold Referendum on New Constitution

docs.snippet: Ivory Coast's parliament on Friday voted overwhelmingly in favor of holding a referendum on a new constitution that would among other measures remove a controversial nationality clause that contributed to years of unrest and civil war....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ivory Coast's parliament on Friday voted overwhelmingly in favor of holding a referendum on a new constitution that would among other measures remove a controversial nationality clause that contributed to years of unrest and civil war.

headline.main: United States, Australia Rebound in UL International Crown
headline.print_headline: United States, Australia Rebound in UL International Crown

docs.snippet: After a rough first day of the UL International Crown, the United States never considered new pairings....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a rough first day of the UL International Crown, the United States never considered new pairings.

docs.snippet: Grain futures were mixed Friday on the Chicago Board of Trade....
docs.lead_paragraph: Grain futures were mixed Friday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

headline.main: California to Require Serial Numbers for Homemade Guns
headline.print_headline: California to Require Serial Numbers for Homemade Guns

docs.snippet: California Gov. Jerry Brown has signed legislation requiring hobbyists who assemble homemade guns to apply for a serial number and submit to a background check....
docs.lead_paragraph: California Gov. Jerry Brown has signed legislation requiring hobbyists who assemble homemade guns to apply for a serial number and submit to a background check.

headline.main: Lobbing 6-Foot-10 Isner, Steve Johnson Into Citi Open SF
headline.print_headline: Lobbing 6-Foot-10 Isner, Steve Johnson Into Citi Open SF

docs.snippet: Trailing in a tiebreaker against top-seeded John Isner, Steve Johnson managed to put a 146 mph serve into play and then decided to try something even more audacious: lob his 6-foot-10 opponent....
docs.lead_paragraph: Trailing in a tiebreaker against top-seeded John Isner, Steve Johnson managed to put a 146 mph serve into play and then decided to try something even more audacious: lob his 6-foot-10 opponent.

headline.main: State Won't Enforce New Abortion Restrictions, for Now
headline.print_headline: State Won't Enforce New Abortion Restrictions, for Now

docs.snippet: Louisiana officials have agreed not to enforce several new restrictions on abortion pending a judge's decision on whether to block the laws....
docs.lead_paragraph: Louisiana officials have agreed not to enforce several new restrictions on abortion pending a judge's decision on whether to block the laws.
